entry.title: Using Environment Protection Rules to Secure Secrets When Building External Forks with pull_request_target 🤐
entry.summary: Building pull requests from forked repositories with GitHub Actions can be a bit tricky when it comes to secrets. As per the documentation, with the exception of GITHUB_TOKEN, secrets are not passed to the runner when a workflow is triggered from a forked repository. This is to prevent the automatic execution of untrusted code that may be contained within the forked repo.

entry.title: Three Ways to Manage Data in Kentico Using PowerShell
entry.summary: PowerShell is the leading task automation platform for Windows. Developers and system administrators from all around the world use it for the most complex deployment and installation scenarios as well as for the simplest scripting. Today, we'll have a look at what we can achieve with PowerShell in combination with the Kentico API and the Kentico REST API.
